function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Participants being asked to rate retrospective health measures before and after COVID-19 measures may introduce recall bias and subjective interpretation.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of the change in perceived health following the pandemic, affecting the reliability of the study findings.","Mitigation":"Provide clear and specific instructions for rating retrospective health measures and utilize additional objective measures where possible to validate self-reported data.","Technologies":"Data validation techniques, such as cross-referencing with medical records or wearable health monitoring devices.","People":"Study participants, researchers conducting the assessments.","Owner":"Research team, data analysts."},{"Description":"The use of a 5-point scale for self-rated health measures may lack granularity and sensitivity to capture nuanced changes in health status.","Impact":"Limited ability to accurately capture subtle changes in health perception, potentially missing important variations in health outcomes.","Mitigation":"Consider using a finer-grained scale or supplementing self-rated measures with validated health assessment tools to capture a wider range of health changes.","Technologies":"Health assessment tools with finer-grained scales or validated psychometric instruments.","People":"Study participants, researchers conducting the assessments.","Owner":"Research team, data analysts."},{"Description":"Covariate measurements such as living alone, education, and occupational social class may not fully capture the complex socioeconomic and environmental factors influencing health outcomes, leading to confounding effects.","Impact":"Potential confounding of study results due to inadequate consideration of all relevant socioeconomic and environmental variables.","Mitigation":"Collect additional contextual data on environmental variables, neighborhood characteristics, and broader socioeconomic factors to account for potential confounders in the analysis.","Technologies":"Geospatial analytics, social determinants of health data collection tools.","People":"Research team, data analysts.","Owner":"Research team, public health agencies."}]}
